alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 23 at 1:29PM PST until December 25 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 3000 feet, heavy snow diminishing. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 to 18 inches possible. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning until 4 PM PST. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous due to snow and ice covered roads, and low visibility.
info.instruction: Be prepared for winter driving conditions with snow and ice covered roads and very limited visibility. If you must travel in the mountains, slow down, and allow plenty of extra time to reach your destination. Allow extra following distance to the vehicle in front of you, and keep snow chains and a winter survival kit, including a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Also please monitor the latest forecasts for Friday and Friday night as more heavy snow is possible. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
